snippets.script:
<script>
    import {
        Form,
        Radio,
        Stack,
        Text,
    } from "@kahi-ui/framework";

    let logic_state = "vanilla";
</script>

<Text is="strong">
    Select an Ice Cream Flavor
    <Text is="sup">{logic_state}</Text>
</Text>

<Stack spacing="small" margin_top="small">
    <Form.Group
        logic_name="radio-preview"
        bind:logic_state
    >
        <Radio
            id="radio-preview-bubblegum"
            palette="accent"
            sizing="tiny"
            value="bubblegum"
        >
            Bubblegum
        </Radio>

        <Radio
            id="radio-preview-chocolate"
            palette="accent"
            sizing="tiny"
            value="chocolate"
        >
            Chocolate
        </Radio>

        <Radio
            id="radio-preview-vanilla"
            palette="accent"
            sizing="tiny"
            value="vanilla"
        >
            Vanilla
        </Radio>
    </Form.Group>
</Stack>

<script>
    import {
        Form,
        Menu,
        Radio,
        Spacer,
    } from "@kahi-ui/framework";
</script>

<Menu.Container>
    <Menu.Heading>Sort By</Menu.Heading>

    <Form.Group
        logic_name="radio-flush"
        logic_state="ascending"
    >
        <Menu.Label for="radio-flush-ascending">
            Ascending
            <Spacer />
            <Radio
                value="ascending"
                palette="accent"
                variation="flush"
            />
        </Menu.Label>

        <Menu.Label for="radio-flush-decending">
            Decending
            <Spacer />
            <Radio
                value="decending"
                palette="accent"
                variation="flush"
            />
        </Menu.Label>
    </Form.Group>
</Menu.Container>

Radio.name: --radio-palette-background-bold
Radio.description: Controls the default RGB color value used for background.

Radio.name: --radio-palette-foreground-normal
Radio.description: Controls the default RGB color value used for color.

Radio.description: Controls the default line-height used.

Radio.name: --radio-disabled-opacity
Radio.description: Controls the opacity used when disabled.

Radio.name: --radio-dot-checked-clip-path
Radio.description: Controls the clip-path: inset used when checked.

Radio.name: --radio-dot-unchecked-clip-path

Radio.name: --radio-dot-font-size
Radio.description: Controls the font-size used.

Radio.description: Controls the default background opacity used.

Radio.name: --radio-block-checked-active-background-opacity
Radio.description: Controls the background opacity used when checked and clicked.

Radio.name: --radio-block-unchecked-active-background-opacity
Radio.description: Controls the background opacity used when unchecked and clicked.

Radio.name: --radio-flush-checked-active-color-opacity
Radio.description: Controls the color opacity used when checked and clicked.

Radio.name: --radio-flush-unchecked-active-color-opacity
Radio.description: Controls the color opacity used when unchecked and clicked.

Radio.name: change
Radio.description: Fires whenever the Radio has its value changed.

Radio.name: input
Radio.description: Fires whenever the Radio has its value changed.

Radio.name: palette
Radio.description: Alters the displayed color scheme.

Radio.name: sizing
Radio.description: Renders the Radio at a different sizes.

Radio.name: variation
Radio.description: Alters the appearance of the Radio.

Radio.name: active
Radio.description: Renders the Radio with aria-pressed attribute, and styles the Radio as if it where being clicked.

Radio.name: disabled
Radio.description: Renders the Radio with disabled attribute, and styles the Radio partially transparent.

Radio.name: name
Radio.description: Sets the form name of the Radio.

Radio.name: state
Radio.description: Sets the checked state of the Radio.

Radio.name: value
Radio.description: Sets the value sent whenever the parent <form> is submitted.

Radio.name: default
Radio.description: Default unnamed slot. Renders the Radio inside a <label>, alongside the sibling slot content.

data.render:
Radio

NOTE: New since v0.2.7.

WARNING: Received a breaking change in v0.5.0.

Radio is typically used to present a set of mutually-exclusive options to the end-user, which they can then choose from.

<script>
    import {
        Form,
        Radio,
        Stack,
        Text,
    } from "@kahi-ui/framework";

    let logic_state = "vanilla";
</script>

<Text is="strong">
    Select an Ice Cream Flavor
    <Text is="sup">{logic_state}</Text>
</Text>

<Stack spacing="small" margin_top="small">
    <Form.Group
        logic_name="radio-preview"
        bind:logic_state
    >
        <Radio
            id="radio-preview-bubblegum"
            palette="accent"
            sizing="tiny"
            value="bubblegum"
        >
            Bubblegum
        </Radio>

        <Radio
            id="radio-preview-chocolate"
            palette="accent"
            sizing="tiny"
            value="chocolate"
        >
            Chocolate
        </Radio>

        <Radio
            id="radio-preview-vanilla"
            palette="accent"
            sizing="tiny"
            value="vanilla"
        >
            Vanilla
        </Radio>
    </Form.Group>
</Stack>

Imports

<script>
    import {Radio} from "@kahi-ui/framework";
</script>

States

You can control the state of the Radio via the active, disabled, and state properties.

<script>
    import {
        Radio,
        Stack,
        Text,
    } from "@kahi-ui/framework";
</script>

<Stack
    class="radio-states"
    orientation="horizontal"
    spacing="medium"
    variation="wrap"
>
    <div>
        <Text is="strong">DEFAULT</Text>
        <Radio />
    </div>

    <div>
        <Text is="strong">STATE</Text>
        <Radio state />
    </div>

    <div>
        <Text is="strong">ACTIVE NO-STATE</Text>
        <Radio active />
    </div>

    <div>
        <Text is="strong">ACTIVE STATE</Text>
        <Radio active state />
    </div>

    <div>
        <Text is="strong">DISABLED NO-STATE</Text>
        <Radio disabled />
    </div>

    <div>
        <Text is="strong">DISABLED STATE</Text>
        <Radio disabled state />
    </div>
</Stack>

<style>
    :global(.radio-states strong) {
        display: block;
    }
</style>

Palette

You can change the color palette of the Radio via the palette property.

<script>
    import {
        Form,
        Radio,
        Stack,
        Text,
    } from "@kahi-ui/framework";
</script>

<Form.Group logic_name="radio-palette">
    <Stack
        class="radio-palette"
        orientation="horizontal"
        spacing="medium"
        variation="wrap"
    >
        <div>
            <Text is="strong">DEFAULT</Text>
            <Radio />
        </div>

        <div>
            <Text is="strong">ACCENT</Text>
            <Radio palette="accent" />
        </div>

        <div>
            <Text is="strong">DARK</Text>
            <Radio palette="dark" />
        </div>

        <div>
            <Text is="strong">LIGHT</Text>
            <Radio palette="light" />
        </div>

        <div>
            <Text is="strong">ALERT</Text>
            <Radio palette="alert" />
        </div>

        <div>
            <Text is="strong">AFFIRMATIVE</Text>
            <Radio palette="affirmative" />
        </div>

        <div>
            <Text is="strong">NEGATIVE</Text>
            <Radio palette="negative" />
        </div>
    </Stack>
</Form.Group>

<style>
    :global(.radio-palette strong) {
        display: block;
    }
</style>
